revised_title: Understanding Polymer Crystallization and Segment Length
tldr: The authors analyze the systematic pleating of polymer molecules in their crystallization and propose a new theory based on crystal growth kinetics. They show that there must be considerable fluctuation in segment length from segment to segment, leading to a characteristic segment length that defines a stable mean strip width. This theory explains the factors that determine the segment length in polymer crystallization and provides a good qualitative and roughly quantitative account of the crystallization process.
